vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

advice.message: According to our scan, you are currently using the most secure version of the selected base image

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package. When sending data to an MQTT server, libcurl <= 7.73.0 and 7.78.0 could in some circumstances erroneously keep a pointer to an already freed memory area and both use that again in a subsequent call to send data and also free it *again*. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `curl`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-22945) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RWLEC6YVEM2HWUBX67SDGPSY4CQB72OE/) - [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1269242) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4
